sentences.sContent: He said he had new evidence, but refused to elaborate any further.
sentences.sCn: 他声称有新证据，但拒绝进一步详细说明。

sentences.sContent: His task was to elaborate policies that would make a market economy compatible with a clean environment.
sentences.sCn: 他的任务是周密地制定能够让市场经济适合于无污染的环境的政策。

synos.tran: 精心制作的；详尽的；煞费苦心的
精心制作；详细阐述；从简单成分合成（复杂有机物）

remMethod.val: e(出)+labor(劳动)+ate(做)→辛苦劳动做出来的→精心制作的

words.tran: 苦心经营，精巧；详细阐述

trans.tranOther: to give more details or new information about something

trans.tranCn: 精心制作的； 详尽的；复杂的
trans.tranOther: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate a plan or theory, you develop it by making it more complicated and more effective
